export const testConnection = async () => {
  try {
    console.log('Testing connection to backend...');
    console.log('API Base URL:', API_BASE_URL);
    console.log('Current token:', localStorage.getItem('access_token') ? 'Present' : 'Missing');
    
    // Test 1: Simple health check (remove /api suffix for root endpoint)
    const healthUrl = API_BASE_URL.replace('/api', '') || '/';
    const healthResponse = await axios.get(healthUrl, { timeout: 5000 });
    console.log('✅ Health check successful:', healthResponse.status);
    
    // Test 2: Try authenticated API call
    try {
      const authResponse = await api.get('/admin/users');
      console.log('✅ Authenticated API test successful');
      return { success: true, status: healthResponse.status, authenticated: true };
    } catch (authError: any) {
      console.log('⚠️  Authentication test failed:', authError.response?.status);
      if (authError.response?.status === 401) {
        return { 
          success: false, 
          error: 'Authentication failed - token expired. Please login again.', 
          code: 'AUTH_ERROR',
          needsLogin: true
        };
      }
      return { success: true, status: healthResponse.status, authenticated: false };
    }
  } catch (error: any) {
    console.error('Connection test failed:', error);
    return { 
      success: false, 
      error: `Cannot connect to backend: ${error.message}`, 
      code: error.code || 'NETWORK_ERROR' 
    };
  }
};

#!/bin/bash
# Domain Configuration Template for Squarespace + AWS EC2 Setup
# Copy this file to 'domain-config.sh' and update with your actual domain

# =============================================================================
# REQUIRED: Update these values with your actual domain information
# =============================================================================

# Your actual domain (registered with Squarespace)
export DOMAIN="deepskilling.com"
export WWW_DOMAIN="www.deepskilling.com"

# Email for SSL certificates (Let's Encrypt notifications)
export SSL_EMAIL="your-email@yourdomain.com"  # ← CHANGE THIS to your email

# =============================================================================
# OPTIONAL: Advanced configuration
# =============================================================================

# Optional subdomains (add DNS A records in Squarespace for these)
export API_DOMAIN="api.yourdomain.com" 
export ADMIN_DOMAIN="admin.yourdomain.com"
export STAGING_DOMAIN="staging.yourdomain.com"

# AWS Configuration
export AWS_REGION="us-west-2"  # Change to your preferred AWS region
export S3_BUCKET="yourdomain-backups"  # For automated backups (optional)

# Database Configuration (for production RDS setup)
export DB_NAME="deepskilling_prod"
export DB_USER="deepskilling_admin"
# Note: DB_PASSWORD should be set securely, not in this file

# SMTP Configuration (for sending emails from your LMS)
export SMTP_SERVER="smtp.gmail.com"  # Or your email provider's SMTP
export SMTP_PORT="587"
export SMTP_USERNAME="your-email@yourdomain.com"
# Note: SMTP_PASSWORD should be set securely, not in this file

# =============================================================================
# SYSTEM CONFIGURATION (usually don't need to change)
# =============================================================================

# Application settings
export APP_DIR="/opt/deepskilling"
export LOG_LEVEL="INFO"  # DEBUG for development, INFO for production
export DEBUG="false"     # Set to "true" only for development

# Security settings
export SECRET_KEY_LENGTH="64"  # Length of auto-generated secret key
export SESSION_TIMEOUT="3600"  # Session timeout in seconds (1 hour)

# Performance settings
export WORKERS="4"  # Number of FastAPI workers (adjust based on CPU cores)
export MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE="10M"  # Maximum file upload size

# =============================================================================
# VALIDATION AND DISPLAY
# =============================================================================

# Validate required settings
if [ "$DOMAIN" = "yourdomain.com" ]; then
    echo "⚠️  WARNING: Please update DOMAIN in domain-config.sh with your real domain!"
fi

if [ "$SSL_EMAIL" = "your-email@yourdomain.com" ]; then
    echo "⚠️  WARNING: Please update SSL_EMAIL in domain-config.sh with your real email!"
fi

# Display configuration
echo ""
echo "🌐 Domain Configuration Loaded:"
echo "├── Main domain: $DOMAIN"
echo "├── WWW domain: $WWW_DOMAIN" 
echo "├── SSL email: $SSL_EMAIL"
echo "├── AWS region: $AWS_REGION"
echo "├── App directory: $APP_DIR"
echo "└── Workers: $WORKERS"

if [ "$API_DOMAIN" != "api.yourdomain.com" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "🔧 Optional subdomains configured:"
    echo "├── API: $API_DOMAIN"
    echo "├── Admin: $ADMIN_DOMAIN"
    echo "└── Staging: $STAGING_DOMAIN"
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ Configuration ready for deployment!"
echo ""

# =============================================================================
# USAGE INSTRUCTIONS
# =============================================================================

cat << 'USAGE'
📋 HOW TO USE THIS CONFIGURATION:

1. Copy this template:
   cp domain-config-template.sh domain-config.sh

2. Edit with your domain:
   nano domain-config.sh
   
3. Update these required values:
   - DOMAIN="your-actual-domain.com"
   - SSL_EMAIL="your-email@your-domain.com"

4. Save and use in deployment:
   source domain-config.sh
   ./ec2-setup.sh
   ./budget-deploy.sh  # or ./aws-deploy.sh
   ./ssl-setup.sh

5. Set up DNS in Squarespace:
   - Add A record: @ → YOUR_EC2_IP
   - Add A record: www → YOUR_EC2_IP
   - Wait 5-15 minutes for propagation

🎉 Your DeepSkilling LMS will be live at https://your-domain.com!

USAGE

```

## 🎯 **DEPLOYMENT STEPS (15 minutes total)**

### **Step 1: Launch AWS EC2 Instance (5 minutes)**

**Go to AWS Console > EC2 > Launch Instance:**

```
Name: deepskilling-production
AMI: Amazon Linux 2 AMI (latest)
Instance Type: t3.small
Key Pair: Select your existing key pair (or create new)
Security Groups: Create new with these rules:
  - SSH (22): Your IP only
  - HTTP (80): 0.0.0.0/0  
  - HTTPS (443): 0.0.0.0/0
Storage: 30 GB gp2 (default)
```

**Click "Launch Instance" and wait ~2 minutes for it to start**

### **Step 2: Get Your Instance IP**
```

```

### **Step 3: Upload Deployment Scripts (2 minutes)**
```bash
# Upload deployment package to EC2
scp -i ~/.ssh/deepskilling_deploy deepskilling-deployment-package.tar.gz ec2-user@YOUR_EC2_IP:~/

ssh -i ~/.ssh/deepskilling_deploy ec2-user@YOUR_EC2_IP

# Extract and prepare scripts
tar -xzf deepskilling-deployment-package.tar.gz
chmod +x *.sh
ls -la  # Verify files uploaded
```

### **Step 4: Run Automated Deployment (8 minutes)**
```bash

## 🆘 **TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE**

### **If Deployment Fails:**
```bash
# Check script logs
cat /tmp/deployment.log

# Check system status  
sudo systemctl status deepskilling nginx

# Restart services
sudo systemctl restart deepskilling nginx

# Re-run specific script if needed
./ec2-setup.sh      # System setup
./budget-deploy.sh  # App deployment  
./ssl-setup.sh      # SSL setup
```

### **If Website Doesn't Load:**
```bash
# Check DNS propagation
dig deepskilling.com
nslookup deepskilling.com

# Check nginx configuration
sudo nginx -t
sudo systemctl status nginx

# Check application logs
sudo tail -f /opt/deepskilling/logs/app.log
```

### **If SSL Doesn't Work:**
```bash
# Check certificate status
sudo certbot certificates

# Renew certificates manually  
sudo certbot renew --dry-run

# Check nginx SSL config
sudo nginx -t
```

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
DeepSkilling Production HTTPS Server
Professional-grade web server with SSL, reverse proxy, and security features
"""

import http.server
import socketserver
import ssl
import urllib.request
import urllib.parse
import json
import gzip
import os
import threading
import logging
from datetime import datetime

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(
    level=logging.INFO,
    format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
    handlers=[
        logging.FileHandler('/opt/deepskilling/server.log'),
        logging.StreamHandler()
    ]
)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

class ProductionHTTPSHandler(http.server.SimpleHTTPRequestHandler):
    """Production HTTPS Handler with reverse proxy and security features"""
    
    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        # Set the directory to serve static files from
        self.directory = '/opt/deepskilling/frontend/build'
        super().__init__(*args, directory=self.directory, **kwargs)
    
    def log_message(self, format, *args):
        """Custom logging"""
        logger.info(f"{self.client_address[0]} - {format % args}")
    
    def add_security_headers(self):
        """Add security headers"""
        self.send_header('X-Frame-Options', 'DENY')
        self.send_header('X-Content-Type-Options', 'nosniff')
        self.send_header('X-XSS-Protection', '1; mode=block')
        self.send_header('Strict-Transport-Security', 'max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains')
        self.send_header('Referrer-Policy', 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin')
        self.send_header('Content-Security-Policy', "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval' https://www.googletagmanager.com https://www.google-analytics.com; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' https://fonts.googleapis.com; font-src 'self' https://fonts.gstatic.com; img-src 'self' data: https:; connect-src 'self' https://www.google-analytics.com;")
    
    def add_cors_headers(self):
        """Add CORS headers for API requests"""
        self.send_header('Access-Control-Allow-Origin', 'https://deepskilling.com')
        self.send_header('Access-Control-Allow-Methods', 'GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, OPTIONS')
        self.send_header('Access-Control-Allow-Headers', 'Content-Type, Authorization')
    
    def handle_api_request(self, method='GET'):
        """Handle API requests by proxying to backend"""
        try:
            # Remove /api prefix and forward to backend
            backend_path = self.path[4:]  # Remove '/api'
            backend_url = f'http://localhost:8000{backend_path}'
            
            # Prepare request data
            headers = {}
            for key, value in self.headers.items():
                if key.lower() not in ['host', 'connection']:
                    headers[key] = value
            
            # Handle request data for POST/PUT
            data = None
            if method in ['POST', 'PUT', 'PATCH']:
                content_length = int(self.headers.get('Content-Length', 0))
                if content_length > 0:
                    data = self.rfile.read(content_length)
            
            # Create and send request
            req = urllib.request.Request(backend_url, data=data, headers=headers, method=method)
            
            with urllib.request.urlopen(req, timeout=30) as response:
                self.send_response(response.getcode())
                
                # Copy response headers
                for header, value in response.headers.items():
                    if header.lower() not in ['connection', 'transfer-encoding']:
                        self.send_header(header, value)
                
                self.add_cors_headers()
                self.end_headers()
                
                # Stream response data
                while True:
                    chunk = response.read(8192)
                    if not chunk:
                        break
                    self.wfile.write(chunk)
                
        except urllib.error.HTTPError as e:
            self.send_response(e.code)
            self.send_header('Content-Type', 'application/json')
            self.add_cors_headers()
            self.end_headers()
            error_response = json.dumps({
                'error': f'Backend error: {e.reason}',
                'status': e.code
            }).encode()
            self.wfile.write(error_response)
            
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f'API proxy error: {str(e)}')
            self.send_response(502)
            self.send_header('Content-Type', 'application/json')
            self.add_cors_headers()
            self.end_headers()
            error_response = json.dumps({
                'error': 'Backend unavailable',
                'message': str(e)
            }).encode()
            self.wfile.write(error_response)
    
    def do_GET(self):
        """Handle GET requests"""
        # Handle API requests
        if self.path.startswith('/api/'):
            return self.handle_api_request('GET')
        
        # Handle static files with proper caching
        if self.path.startswith('/static/'):
            self.send_response(200)
            if self.path.endswith('.js'):
                self.send_header('Content-Type', 'application/javascript')
            elif self.path.endswith('.css'):
                self.send_header('Content-Type', 'text/css')
            elif self.path.endswith('.png'):
                self.send_header('Content-Type', 'image/png')
            elif self.path.endswith('.jpg') or self.path.endswith('.jpeg'):
                self.send_header('Content-Type', 'image/jpeg')
            elif self.path.endswith('.svg'):
                self.send_header('Content-Type', 'image/svg+xml')
            
            # Cache static assets for 1 year
            self.send_header('Cache-Control', 'public, max-age=31536000, immutable')
            self.add_security_headers()
            return super().do_GET()
        
        # Handle root and React routes
        self.add_security_headers()
        return super().do_GET()
    
    def do_POST(self):
        """Handle POST requests"""
        if self.path.startswith('/api/'):
            return self.handle_api_request('POST')
        else:
            self.send_response(405)
            self.send_header('Content-Type', 'text/plain')
            self.end_headers()
            self.wfile.write(b'Method not allowed')
    
    def do_PUT(self):
        """Handle PUT requests"""
        if self.path.startswith('/api/'):
            return self.handle_api_request('PUT')
        else:
            self.send_response(405)
            self.end_headers()
    
    def do_DELETE(self):
        """Handle DELETE requests"""
        if self.path.startswith('/api/'):
            return self.handle_api_request('DELETE')
        else:
            self.send_response(405)
            self.end_headers()
    
    def do_OPTIONS(self):
        """Handle CORS preflight requests"""
        self.send_response(200)
        self.add_cors_headers()
        self.end_headers()

class ThreadedHTTPSServer(socketserver.ThreadingMixIn, http.server.HTTPServer):
    """Threaded HTTPS server for better performance"""
    daemon_threads = True
    allow_reuse_address = True

def start_https_server():
    """Start the production HTTPS server"""
    
    # Change to frontend build directory
    os.chdir('/opt/deepskilling/frontend/build')
    
    # Configure server
    server_address = ('', 443)
    
    try:
        # Create server
        httpd = ThreadedHTTPSServer(server_address, ProductionHTTPSHandler)
        
        # Configure SSL
        context = ssl.create_default_context(ssl.Purpose.CLIENT_AUTH)
        context.minimum_version = ssl.TLSVersion.TLSv1_2
        context.maximum_version = ssl.TLSVersion.TLSv1_3
        context.set_ciphers('ECDHE+AESGCM:ECDHE+CHACHA20:DHE+AESGCM:DHE+CHACHA20:!aNULL:!MD5:!DSS')
        
        # Load SSL certificates
        context.load_cert_chain(
            '/etc/letsencrypt/live/deepskilling.com/fullchain.pem',
            '/etc/letsencrypt/live/deepskilling.com/privkey.pem'
        )
        
        # Wrap socket with SSL
        httpd.socket = context.wrap_socket(httpd.socket, server_side=True)
        
        logger.info('🔐 DeepSkilling Production HTTPS Server Starting...')
        logger.info(f'🌐 Server: https://deepskilling.com')
        logger.info(f'📁 Static Files: /opt/deepskilling/frontend/build')
        logger.info(f'🔗 API Proxy: /api/* → http://localhost:8000/*')
        logger.info(f'🛡️  Security: Headers, CORS, SSL/TLS 1.2+')
        logger.info(f'⚡ Performance: Threading, Caching, Gzip')
        print('')
        print('🎉 Production server is now running!')
        print('   Visit: https://deepskilling.com')
        print('')
        
        # Start server
        httpd.serve_forever()
        
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f'Failed to start server: {str(e)}')
        raise

if __name__ == '__main__':
    start_https_server()

            with open(index_path, 'rb') as f:
                content = f.read()
            
            self.send_response(200)
            self.send_header('Content-Type', 'text/html; charset=utf-8')
            self.send_header('Content-Length', str(len(content)))
            self.send_header('Cache-Control', 'no-cache')
            self.add_security_headers()
            self.end_headers()
            self.wfile.write(content)
            
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f'Error serving index.html: {str(e)}')
            self.send_error(500)
    
    def do_POST(self):
        """Handle POST requests"""
        if self.path.startswith('/api/'):
            return self.handle_api_request('POST')
        else:
            self.send_error(405)
    
    def do_PUT(self):
        """Handle PUT requests"""
        if self.path.startswith('/api/'):
            return self.handle_api_request('PUT')
        else:
            self.send_error(405)
    
    def do_DELETE(self):
        """Handle DELETE requests"""
        if self.path.startswith('/api/'):
            return self.handle_api_request('DELETE')
        else:
            self.send_error(405)
    
    def do_OPTIONS(self):
        """Handle CORS preflight requests"""
        self.send_response(200)
        self.add_cors_headers()
        self.end_headers()

class ThreadedHTTPSServer(socketserver.ThreadingMixIn, http.server.HTTPServer):
    """Threaded HTTPS server for better performance"""
    daemon_threads = True
    allow_reuse_address = True

def start_https_server():
    """Start the production HTTPS server"""
    
    # Configure server
    server_address = ('', 443)
    
    try:
        # Create server
        httpd = ThreadedHTTPSServer(server_address, ProductionHTTPSHandler)
        
        # Configure SSL
        context = ssl.create_default_context(ssl.Purpose.CLIENT_AUTH)
        context.minimum_version = ssl.TLSVersion.TLSv1_2
        context.maximum_version = ssl.TLSVersion.TLSv1_3
        context.set_ciphers('ECDHE+AESGCM:ECDHE+CHACHA20:DHE+AESGCM:DHE+CHACHA20:!aNULL:!MD5:!DSS')
        
        # Load SSL certificates
        context.load_cert_chain(
            '/etc/letsencrypt/live/deepskilling.com/fullchain.pem',
            '/etc/letsencrypt/live/deepskilling.com/privkey.pem'
        )
        
        # Wrap socket with SSL
        httpd.socket = context.wrap_socket(httpd.socket, server_side=True)
        
        logger.info('🔐 DeepSkilling Production HTTPS Server Starting...')
        logger.info(f'🌐 Server: https://deepskilling.com')
        logger.info(f'📁 Static Files: /opt/deepskilling/frontend/build')
        logger.info(f'🔗 API Proxy: /api/* → http://localhost:8000/*')
        logger.info(f'🛡️  Security: Headers, CORS, SSL/TLS 1.2+')
        logger.info(f'⚡ Performance: Threading, Caching, Static Files')
        print('')
        print('🎉 FIXED Production server is now running!')
        print('   Visit: https://deepskilling.com')
        print('')
        
        # Start server
        httpd.serve_forever()
        
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f'Failed to start server: {str(e)}')
        raise

if __name__ == '__main__':
    start_https_server()

```typescriptreact
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { Link, useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom';
import { useAuth } from '../contexts/AuthContext';
import { validateEmail, validateRequired, validateForm, extractErrorMessage } from '../utils/validation';
import { BookOpen } from 'lucide-react';
import { showToast } from '../utils/toast';

const Login: React.FC = () => {
  const [formData, setFormData] = useState({
    email: '',
    password: ''
  });
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const [errors, setErrors] = useState<Record<string, string>>({});
  const [touched, setTouched] = useState<Record<string, boolean>>({});
  const [loginError, setLoginError] = useState<string>('');
  const { login } = useAuth();
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  // Check for persistent error on component mount
  useEffect(() => {
    const persistentError = localStorage.getItem('loginError');
    if (persistentError) {
      setLoginError(persistentError);
    }
  }, []);


  const validateField = (name: string, value: string) => {
    switch (name) {
      case 'email':
        return validateEmail(value);
      case 'password':
        return validateRequired(value, 'Password');
      default:
        return { isValid: true };
    }
  };

  const handleChange = (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, [name]: value }));

    // Real-time validation
    if (touched[name]) {
      const validation = validateField(name, value);
      setErrors(prev => ({
        ...prev,
        [name]: extractErrorMessage(validation.error || '')
      }));
    }
  };

  const handleBlur = (e: React.FocusEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setTouched(prev => ({ ...prev, [name]: true }));
    
    const validation = validateField(name, value);
    setErrors(prev => ({
      ...prev,
      [name]: extractErrorMessage(validation.error || '')
    }));
  };

  const validateAllFields = (): boolean => {
    const validations = [
      validateEmail(formData.email),
      validateRequired(formData.password, 'Password')
    ];

    const result = validateForm(validations);
    
    if (!result.isValid) {
      // Set all fields as touched to show errors
      setTouched({
        email: true,
        password: true
      });

      // Set individual field errors
      setErrors({
        email: validateEmail(formData.email).error || '',
        password: validateRequired(formData.password, 'Password').error || ''
      });

      // Show validation error in closable toast 
      showToast.closable(result.errors[0], 'error');
      return false;
    }

    return true;
  };


  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-secondary-50 flex items-center justify-center py-12 px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8">
      <div className="max-w-md w-full space-y-8">
        <div className="text-center">
          <div className="flex justify-center">
            <BookOpen className="h-12 w-12 text-primary-600" />
          </div>
          <h2 className="mt-6 text-3xl font-bold text-secondary-900">
            Sign in to your account
          </h2>
        </div>
        
        <div className="mt-8 space-y-6">
          <div className="card">
            
            {/* Persistent Login Error Display - DOM-based */}
            <div id="persistent-login-error"></div>
            
            {/* Login Error Display - React state based */}
            {loginError && (
              <div className="mb-4 p-3 bg-red-50 border border-red-200 rounded-lg">
                <p className="text-sm text-red-600 font-medium flex items-center">
                  <svg className="h-4 w-4 mr-2" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 20 20">
                    <path fillRule="evenodd" d="M10 18a8 8 0 100-16 8 8 0 000 16zM8.707 7.293a1 1 0 00-1.414 1.414L8.586 10l-1.293 1.293a1 1 0 101.414 1.414L10 11.414l1.293 1.293a1 1 0 001.414-1.414L11.414 10l1.293-1.293a1 1 0 00-1.414-1.414L10 8.586 8.707 7.293z" clipRule="evenodd" />
                  </svg>
                  {loginError}
                </p>
              </div>
            )}
            
            <div className="space-y-4">
              <div>
                <label htmlFor="email" className="form-label">
                  Email *
                </label>
                <div className="mt-1">
                  <input
                    id="email"
                    name="email"
                    type="email"
                    autoComplete="email"
                    required
                    className={`form-input ${
                      errors.email && touched.email ? 'border-red-500 focus:ring-red-500' : ''
                    }`}
                    placeholder="Enter your email"
                    value={formData.email}
                    onChange={handleChange}
                    onBlur={handleBlur}
                  />
                                  {errors.email && touched.email && (
                  <p className="mt-1 text-sm text-red-600">
                    {typeof errors.email === 'string' ? errors.email : 'Invalid email'}
                  </p>
                )}
                </div>
              </div>
              
              <div>
                <label htmlFor="password" className="form-label">
                  Password *
                </label>
                <div className="mt-1">
                  <input
                    id="password"
                    name="password"
                    type="password"
                    autoComplete="current-password"
                    required
                    className={`form-input ${
                      errors.password && touched.password ? 'border-red-500 focus:ring-red-500' : ''
                    }`}
                    placeholder="Enter your password"
                    value={formData.password}
                    onChange={handleChange}
                    onBlur={handleBlur}
                  />
                                  {errors.password && touched.password && (
                  <p className="mt-1 text-sm text-red-600">
                    {typeof errors.password === 'string' ? errors.password : 'Invalid password'}
                  </p>
                )}
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>


            <div className="mt-6">
              <button
                type="button"
                onClick={() => {
                  console.log('Login button clicked');
                  
                  // Clear previous login error when attempting new login
                  setLoginError('');
                  localStorage.removeItem('loginError');
                  
                  if (!validateAllFields()) {
                    return;
                  }

                  setLoading(true);
                  
                  // Use setTimeout to ensure the login call doesn't interfere with toast
                  setTimeout(() => {
                    console.log('Starting login attempt...');
                    login(formData.email, formData.password)
                      .then(() => {
                        console.log('Login successful');
                        navigate('/dashboard');
                      })
                      .catch((error) => {
                        console.log('Login error caught:', error);
                        const errorMessage = error.message || 'Login failed. Please try again.';
                        console.log('Setting loginError state:', errorMessage);
                        
                        // Set state for persistent display
                        setLoginError(errorMessage);
                        
                        // Also store in localStorage for persistence across any state resets
                        localStorage.setItem('loginError', errorMessage);
                      })
                      .finally(() => {
                        console.log('Setting loading to false');
                        setLoading(false);
                      });
                  }, 10);
                }}
                className="w-full btn-primary py-3 text-lg"
              >
                {loading ? 'Signing in...' : 'Sign in'}
              </button>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>


      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default Login; 
```
